page.title: 17LEY FARM
page.content: IN HALTON THERE USED TO BE A BUSY MINE, BUT IT WAS CLOSED AND ALL THE MINERS HOUSES KNOCKED DOWN AND COUNCIL HOUSES BUILT IN THEIR PLACE. BUT NOW COAL IS GOING TO BE MINED AGAIN. AT A PLACE CALLED LEY FARM THERE IS A LOT OF COAL CLOSE TO THE SURFACE AND IT IS TO BE OPEN CAST MINED. IT WILL TAKE ABOUT 2 YEARS AND WILL MAKE ABOUT 20 MORE JOBS IN THE AREA WHICH IS IMPORTANT AT PRESENT BECAUSE OF THE HIGH UNEMPLOYMENT. WHEN IT IS FINISHED, THE COAL BOARD PROMISE TO MAKE ALL THE FIELDS LOOK JUST THE SAME AS THEY DO NOW. THERE HAD TO BE AN ENQUIRY BEFORE MINING WAS ALLOWED, BUT AS COAL IS SO PRECIOUS BECAUSE OF NATURAL RESOURCES BEING SHORT, IT WAS ALLOWED.
